text:
50F w/ b/l LE weakness & SOB (desats to 45%) -> T7-9 vert body/epidural
   abscess s/p T2-L1 posterior fusion, T7-9 osteotomies, T2-L1
   instrumentation and IVC filter [**5-10**], c/b C.diff, s/p L thoracotomy,
   T6-8 partial vertebrectomies, T6-9 fusion [**5-20**], c/b epidural hematoma
   s/p I&D, wound debridement [**5-22**], s/p trach [**6-5**].
   Chief complaint:
   PMHx:
   PMH: HTN, DM2, neuropathy, COPD (recent intubation), IgG & IgA
   deficiency, colon ca, MRSA osteomyelitis (MTP joint), PE, anemia, CHF,
   hyperlipid, C.diff colitis
   PSH: colectomy/colostomy, toe amp ([**1-19**]), TAH
   Anxiety
   Assessment:
   Patient alert agitated, sinus tachycardia 130
s unable to follow simple
   commands.
   Action:
   Ativan po given with Zyprexa through doboff tube.
   Response:
   Patient able to be redirected and rest.
   Plan:
   Continue with current plan of care provide comfort and redirection.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Patient  respirations  high 20
s labored breathing noted on ventilator.
   Action:
   Chest x-ray continues to show bilateral pleural effusions, lasix 20mg
   iv given. Ventilator settings change to 10 peep and 10 of pp.
   Response:
   Plan:
   ? ultrasound tomorrow and tapping of pleural effusions. Notify team of
   any changes
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Patient  nodding when asked if pain is present facial exhibiting
   observed.
   Action:
   Medicating with oxycodone liquid and dilaudid for pain.
   Response:
   Patient relaxes
   Plan:
   Patient NPO at midnight  for peg placement tomorrow.

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
